usage: A chest for players to store and take treasures
interactivity: its hinged lid could be opened
interactionDeduction: Users will approach the treasure chest and use their hands to press down on the hinged lid to open it. The interaction will involve a momentary tap or sustained pressure on the lid, simulating the action of lifting it. The wooden texture will provide a tactile feedback, and users may feel a slight resistance as they push down before the lid opens. The chest will respond by visually animating the lid opening, possibly with a creaking sound to enhance the realism.

usage: players will use it to open a tresure chest
interactionDeduction: Users will grasp the key using a precision grip, holding it between their thumb and index finger. The interaction will involve a turning motion as they insert the key into the lock of the treasure chest. The smooth texture of the key will provide a comfortable feel in the user's hand. Users will likely perform a twisting action to simulate unlocking the chest, which will respond with a visual cue indicating the lock has been disengaged.

usage: players will use it to smash things
inertia: relatively heavy with the center of mass concentrated at one end
interactionDeduction: Users will grasp the hammer using a power grip, wrapping their hand around the round handle. The interaction will involve lifting the hammer and swinging it downwards to smash virtual objects. The relatively heavy weight and concentrated center of mass will provide a sense of inertia, making the hammer feel substantial during use. Users will experience a strong haptic feedback as they strike, simulating the impact of a real hammer hitting a surface.

usage: players will punch it for blowing off steam
outline: the punching bag is positioned on the ground. make sure a proxy's volume covers this punching bag
hardness: feeling a little bit soft while punching
interactionDeduction: Users will approach the scarecrow punching bag and use their fists to punch it, employing a contact method that involves a quick, forceful strike. The interaction will likely involve a sustained contact as users may repeatedly hit the bag to blow off steam. The punching bag will feel slightly soft upon impact, providing a cushioning effect that simulates a real punching bag. Users will experience a satisfying feedback from the bag as it sways and rebounds after each punch, enhancing the physicality of the interaction.
